titleproper.value: Guide to the Q-Wave Costumes and Posters from Lunar New Year for All Parades <num>TAM.685</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: Q-Wave Costumes and Posters from Lunar New Year for All Parades

extent.value: in 2 record cartons, 1 small flat box, 13 oversize flat files, and 1 oversize portfolio

abstract.value: Q-Wave is a community organization dedicated to the support of and advocacy for individuals of Asian and/or Pacific Islander descent who identify as gay, lesbian, bisexual, queer, transgender, gender variant, or questioning. The organization aims to promote visibility and empowerment through various forms of social, political, and educational organizing, including lectures, workshops, film screenings, and participation in public demonstrations. This collection consists of materials created and used for the Q-Wave contingent of the 2014 and 2015 Lunar New Year for All parades in New York City. Materials include a rainbow sash, two sheep costumes to celebrate the Year of the Sheep, and 14 demonstration posters with messages in Chinese, English, and Japanese promoting inclusivity and challenging homophobia and discrimination.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Q-Wave Costumes and Posters from Lunar New Year for All Parades; TAM 685; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

Donated by Stephanie Hsu on behalf of Lunar New Year For All in 2015. The accession number associated with this gift is 2016.009. Stephanie Hsu donated an additional 20 posters from the 2017 Lunar New Year for All parade in 2018. The accession number associated with this gift is 2018.093.

Q-Wave is a community organization dedicated to the support of and advocacy for individuals of Asian and/or Pacific Islander descent who identify as gay, lesbian, bisexual, queer, transgender, gender variant, or questioning. The organization aims to promote visibility and empowerment through various forms of social, political, and educational organizing, including lectures, workshops, film screenings, and participation in public demonstrations like Lunar New Year parades. Q-Wave often collaborates with other groups in their efforts, including The Asian Pride Project, Gay Asian & Pacific Islander Men of New York (GAPIMNY), the National Queer Asian Pacific Islander Alliance (NQAPIA), Project Reach NYC, SALGA-NYC, and Tarab NYC.

20 oversize posters added to the collection in 2018 feature signs and artwork from the 2017 Lunar New Year for All parade. Posters contain writing in English and Chinese celebrating the year of the rooster, which feature hand drawn and painted artwork by parade participants.

subject.value: Asian Americans -- New York (State) -- New York.
